sage.scene

Class Group

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Group
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<SceneNode>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SkyBox, TerrainPage

    public class Group
extends SceneNode
implements java.lang.Iterable<SceneNode>
    A Group is a SceneNode which has no screen representation but rather contains a set of (zero or more) children, each of which can in turn be a SceneNode -- meaning either another (sub-)Group or a Leaf. Group is an example of the Composite design pattern.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class sage.scene.SceneNode

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(SceneNode s)
      Adds the specified SceneNode to the list of children of this Group.
      protected void applyRenderStatesToSceneNode(java.util.Stack<RenderState>[] states)
      Applies the specified stack of render states to each child by calling updateRenderStates(states) on each child.
      boolean contains(SceneNode child)
      Returns true if the specified SceneNode is directly a child of this Group; false otherwise.
      void draw(IRenderer r)
      calling draw() on a Group is an error; only Leafs have drawable content.
      SceneNode getChild(java.lang.String name)
      Returns a reference to the first child node with the specified name, or null if no such child exists in the Group.
      java.util.Iterator<SceneNode> getChildren()
      Returns an object of type Iterator which can be used to access the children of this Group.
      int getNumberOfChildren()
      Returns the number of children in the Group.
      java.util.Iterator<SceneNode> iterator()
      Returns an object of type Iterator which iterates over the SceneNodes of this Group's children.
      SceneNode removeChild(SceneNode target)
      removes the specified SceneNode from the child list of this group.
      void setLocalBound(BoundingVolume bv)
      Sets the "local bound" of this Group by telling all children to set their "local bound" to the specified BV.
      void updateLocalBound()
      Updates the "local bound" of this Group by telling all children to update their local bound.
      protected void updateTransforms(double time)
      Updates the world data for this GroupupdateTransforms() method to invoke any attached controllers and to update the node's world transform, then forces propagation of the world transform update down the scenegraph by call updateGeometricState() in each child.
      void updateWorldBound()
      Recomputes the world bound of this Group by computing the "merge" of the world bounds of all children and assigning that as the world bound of this Group.

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        public void addChild(SceneNode s)
        Adds the specified SceneNode to the list of children of this Group. Also sets the parent of the added node to be "this" node.
        Parameters:
        s - The SceneNode to be added

      • removeChild

        public SceneNode removeChild(SceneNode target)
        removes the specified SceneNode from the child list of this group.
        Parameters:
        target - The SceneNode to be removed
        Returns:
        Null if the target was not contained in the Group; otherwise returns a reference to the removed SceneNode.

      • getNumberOfChildren

        public int getNumberOfChildren()
        Returns the number of children in the Group.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<SceneNode> iterator()
        Returns an object of type Iterator which iterates over the SceneNodes of this Group's children. This method is provided to comply with the Java Iterable interface so that a Group can be the target of a Java for-each loop.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<SceneNode>

      • getChildren

        public java.util.Iterator<SceneNode> getChildren()
        Returns an object of type Iterator which can be used to access the children of this Group.
        Returns:
        An iterator over the children of this Group.

      • getChild

        public SceneNode getChild(java.lang.String name)
        Returns a reference to the first child node with the specified name, or null if no such child exists in the Group.

      • updateTransforms

        protected void updateTransforms(double time)
        Updates the world data for this GroupupdateTransforms() method to invoke any attached controllers and to update the node's world transform, then forces propagation of the world transform update down the scenegraph by call updateGeometricState() in each child.
        Overrides:
        updateTransforms in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        time - the elapsed time since the last invocation
        See Also:
        updateTransforms(double)

      • draw

        public void draw(IRenderer r)
        calling draw() on a Group is an error; only Leafs have drawable content. The method must exist, however, because it is specified (as abstract) in the parent class (SceneNode).
        Specified by:
        draw in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        r - - the IRenderer to be used to do the drawing

      • setLocalBound

        public void setLocalBound(BoundingVolume bv)
        Sets the "local bound" of this Group by telling all children to set their "local bound" to the specified BV.
        Specified by:
        setLocalBound in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        bv - The new local bounding volume for this node.

      • updateLocalBound

        public void updateLocalBound()
        Updates the "local bound" of this Group by telling all children to update their local bound.
        Specified by:
        updateLocalBound in class SceneNode

      • updateWorldBound

        public void updateWorldBound()
        Recomputes the world bound of this Group by computing the "merge" of the world bounds of all children and assigning that as the world bound of this Group.
        Specified by:
        updateWorldBound in class SceneNode

      • applyRenderStatesToSceneNode

        protected void applyRenderStatesToSceneNode(java.util.Stack<RenderState>[] states)
        Applies the specified stack of render states to each child by calling updateRenderStates(states) on each child.
        Specified by:
        applyRenderStatesToSceneNode in class SceneNode
        Parameters:
        states - The Stack[] of render states to apply to each child.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(SceneNode child)
        Returns true if the specified SceneNode is directly a child of this Group; false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        child - - the SceneNode for which Group membership is being asked
        Returns:
        true if the specified SceneNode is a child of this Group; false otherwise
